Posts.Content: Nov 10, 2010 07:16AM Monty wrote: Hi,  I was worried about the same thing when I was going through chemo, and buying hats, caps etc can be very expensive so I found a great sewing pattern and made my own.  The pattern is made by McCalls, pattern number 4116.  I am not the worlds best at sewing but this pattern was easy to follow and you could make a cap in about 30 minutes.  They do not take much material so it keeps the cost down and you can make them in any colour or fabric you like so you can match to as may outfits as you want. I have made caps for many other BC patients also and I have loaned out the pattern too.  Give it a try, it makes feeling better so much easier.  You can purchase the pattern on line, just search McCalls Pattern 4116 and the web will take you right there, if you cannot sew maybe a family member or friend can help you out. Gaynor

Posts.Content: Sep 25, 2010 04:22AM Monty wrote: Hi Ladies, I have found this to be a very interesting thread.  Many times over thelast 2 years friends and family have asked me pretty much the same question.  My Mom likes to believe I'm cured and I try to tell her as nicely as possible that there is no cure and there are no guarantees that this disease will not come back but I did the full treatment once and I'll do it again if I have to.  I personally tell people "I was diagnosed with BC in 2008"  that way I don't have to say cured or NED or in remission - as I just don't know?   When I was first diagmosed I thought I was going to die real soon, after all it is the BIG C.  Two years later I have a more philosophical approach, I try to live life and enjoy my family & friends as best I can because now I appreciate how fast your life here can be taken.  I do not worry every single day anymore, but I cannot say that the thought of BC coming back doesn't cross my mind.  For some reason I have a feeling that it's not if but when, maybe a few more years behind me and my thoughts on that will change also. Great thread Ladies, thank you Gaynor
